messages: c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (04:17): Ah, that's better.  512MB.  Tried to boot NetBSD/i386 with GNOME 2.14 on Xen with only 64MB allocated.  Now _that_ was painful.
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:19): Is there a smart reason to have "USE_TOOLS+=             perl" in the wget's Makefile?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:23): is there a "smart reason"? what are you insinuating here?
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:23): sphex, does wget require perl?
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:24): then why that directive?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:25): claudio`: so what do you conclude? that this package's maintainer is on a secret cabal to promote perl? or that he's dumb? or what?
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (04:25): perhaps perl is needed to built it?
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:25): sphex, you should read better when the people write something.
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:26): I just want to understand why that directive.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:26): actually, it's for building the documentation
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:26): jakllsch, yes.. i know. Should be an option, imnsho
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:26): looks like the docs are written in texinfo and a perl util is used to convert it to manpages
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:27): yes, but should be an option for me, as i told.
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (04:27): well, sure, but who doesn't want man pages?
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:28): yes, i really don't need it at all
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:28): for sure i don't need perl.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:28): claudio`: that's your problem
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (04:30): root@unex ~$ sysctl -w kern.ipc.shmmni=256
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (04:30): kern.ipc.shmmni: 128 -> 256
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (04:39): Ok, g'night.
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (04:40): 'night Unex
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (04:40): i am trying to start a ssh-server but "/etc/rc.d/sshd start" doesnt work.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:42): ruelle: did you enable it in rc.conf?
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (04:43): freebsd understands "/etc/rc.d/sshd start"
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (04:43): sphex: do i have to reboot after enabling it?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:43): ruelle: you need sshd=YES in rc.conf for rc.d/sshd to do anything. AFAIK, freebsd is the same since it imported rc.d from netbsd.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:43): ruelle: no
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:44): but maybe they changed that in freebsd...
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (04:52): sshd is running but i can login. it doenst accept the password
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:53): ruelle: as what user?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:53): you can't login as root by default
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (04:53): nor should you
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (04:55): now i can login as root
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (05:02): next problem: # pkg_add http://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/pkgsrc/packages-2006Q2/NetBSD-3.0/i386/chat/irssi-0.8.10a.tgz
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (05:02): ftp: Connect to address `2001:4f8:1:c:2e0:81ff:fe30:95bd': No route to host
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (05:04): i am not using ipv6 on any computer and i can download this file from another machine.
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:05): ruelle:
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:05): just wait
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:05): it moves on to an ipv4 server ?=
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:07): yes.. somehow.
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:08): i just do like this
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:08): echo "204.152.184.36    ftp.netbsd.org" >> /etc/hosts
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:08): :>
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:08): not the right way but..
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (05:15): how can i set the hostname?
3589a3910ec86666f01220f0ae649866 (05:15): i think i have found it
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:35): ruelle: echo "hostname=youdesiredhostname" >> /etc/rc.conf
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (05:35): off to sleep
